intro: Alyssum campestre var. hirsutum, commonly known as hairy田野 Alyssum, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its compact growth habit and long blooming period make it a valuable addition to pollinator-friendly landscapes.
